fine_dining.name: La Réserve Rimbaud
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant riverside dining room with Lez River views and terrace
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book at least two weeks in advance, request riverside terrace in summer
fine_dining.local_tips: Chef Charles Fontes creates refined dishes using the freshest seasonal ingredients from Languedoc

fine_dining.name: Le Jardin des Sens
signature_dishes: Mediterranean sea bass with olive oil foam
fine_dining.atmosphere: Modern elegant dining room with contemporary art and garden views
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book at least three weeks in advance, opt for the tasting menu for the full experience
fine_dining.local_tips: The legendary Pourcel twins' flagship restaurant, recently relocated and reimagined after a hiatus

fine_dining.name: Pastis Kitchen
fine_dining.atmosphere: Intimate contemporary space with open kitchen
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book at least two weeks in advance, counter seating available to watch the chefs
fine_dining.location: Historic center near Place de la Canourgue
fine_dining.local_tips: Chef Daniel Lutrand works with daily market ingredients, creating an ever-changing menu

fine_dining.name: Leclere
fine_dining.atmosphere: Sleek, minimalist dining room with terrace in historic building
fine_dining.booking_tips: Reserve at least two weeks ahead, excellent lunch menu offers great value
fine_dining.local_tips: Chef's technical precision and creative presentations make this a rising star in Montpellier's dining scene

fine_dining.name: La Coquerie
fine_dining.atmosphere: Sophisticated dining room with understated elegance
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book at least one week in advance, lunch offers excellent value for the quality
fine_dining.local_tips: Chef Matthieu de Lauzun creates precise, flavorful dishes that highlight the best local ingredients

casual_dining.name: L'Entrecôte
casual_dining.atmosphere: Classic bistro with close-set tables and bustling service
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book several days ahead, especially for weekend dinners
casual_dining.location: Historic center near Place de la Comédie
casual_dining.local_tips: Famous for their single menu: salad, steak with unlimited frites, and dessert - simple but perfectly executed

casual_dining.name: La Panacée Café
casual_dining.atmosphere: Bright modern space within contemporary art center with courtyard
casual_dining.booking_tips: Reservation recommended for dinner and Sunday brunch
casual_dining.location: Historic center in MOCO art center
casual_dining.local_tips: Popular with the creative crowd, excellent spot to combine with visiting the art exhibitions

casual_dining.name: Les Bains
casual_dining.atmosphere: Elegant brasserie in converted bathhouse with terrace
casual_dining.booking_tips: Reserve for lunch, especially for terrace seating in good weather
casual_dining.local_tips: Historic location in ancient public baths, excellent seafood selection

casual_dining.name: Le Petit Jardin
casual_dining.atmosphere: Romantic garden setting in the historic center
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book at least a week ahead and request garden seating in good weather
casual_dining.local_tips: One of the most beautiful outdoor dining settings in Montpellier, magical in summer

casual_dining.name: Burger & Brass
casual_dining.booking_tips: Arrive early for dinner to avoid waiting, busiest on weekends
casual_dining.local_tips: Quality ingredients and house-made sauces elevate this beyond typical burger joints

casual_dining.name: La Tomate
casual_dining.atmosphere: Bright, contemporary space with open kitchen
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book a few days ahead, excellent lunch menu value
casual_dining.local_tips: Market-fresh ingredients and excellent daily specials written on the blackboard

casual_dining.name: La Coutinelle
casual_dining.atmosphere: Rustic traditional with stone walls and wooden beams
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book a few days ahead, especially on weekends
casual_dining.local_tips: One of the best places to try authentic regional cuisine from Languedoc and Occitanie

casual_dining.name: L'Artichaut
casual_dining.atmosphere: Bright, modern space with plant-focused decor
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book a few days ahead, popular with health-conscious locals
casual_dining.local_tips: One of Montpellier's best vegetarian restaurants, even meat-eaters are impressed

street_food.name: Les Halles Castellane
street_food.local_tips: The central covered market with excellent seafood counters where you can eat on the spot

street_food.name: Marché du Lez Food Trucks
street_food.local_tips: Trendy outdoor food space with varied options, particularly lively on weekend evenings

street_food.name: Place Jean Jaurès Food Stalls
street_food.local_tips: Student-friendly area with affordable international options, particularly Middle Eastern specialties

street_food.name: La Baraque à Huîtres
street_food.local_tips: No-frills oyster bar where locals come for the freshest seafood, perfect with a glass of Picpoul de Pinet

street_food.name: Crêperie L'Appart
street_food.local_tips: Quick service with quality ingredients, good value and authentic Breton recipes

street_food.name: Pâtisserie du Palais
street_food.local_tips: Historic patisserie offering local specialties including the traditional Grisettes, honey-flavored candies unique to Montpellier

coffee_shops.name: Café BUN
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Minimalist Scandinavian-inspired design with plenty of light
coffee_shops.food_options: Breakfast bowls, avocado toast, freshly baked goods
coffee_shops.local_tips: Montpellier's pioneer specialty coffee shop with serious coffee credentials

coffee_shops.name: The Gazelle
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Bright, plant-filled space with modern furnishings
coffee_shops.food_options: Healthy lunch bowls, vegan options, homemade cakes
coffee_shops.local_tips: Popular with digital nomads, excellent for remote working with good coffee

coffee_shops.name: L'Heure Bleue
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Cozy, eclectic space with book exchange and local art
coffee_shops.local_tips: Friendly neighborhood café with relaxed atmosphere and regular cultural events

coffee_shops.name: Fairview Coffee
coffee_shops.local_tips: Popular expat hangout with excellent weekend brunch, arrive early to avoid waiting

coffee_shops.name: Café de la Mer
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Classic French café with terrace on Comédie square
coffee_shops.local_tips: More about the prime people-watching location than the coffee quality, but a quintessential Montpellier experience

bars.name: Le Courreau des Halles
bars.atmosphere: Rustic-modern wine bar with barrel tables and stone walls
bars.food_options: Excellent tapas, regional charcuterie and cheese plates
bars.local_tips: The place for discovering local wines with knowledgeable staff and well-paired small plates

bars.name: Le Clandestin
bars.atmosphere: Hidden speakeasy with vintage decor and intimate lighting
bars.local_tips: Hidden entrance adds to the experience, make reservations or arrive early

bars.name: La Barbote
signature_drinks: Rotating taps of regional craft beers
bars.atmosphere: Laid-back beer bar with industrial touches
bars.local_tips: The best craft beer selection in town with knowledgeable staff and regular tasting events

bars.name: Terrasse Pétanque
bars.atmosphere: Large outdoor space with pétanque courts and relaxed vibe
bars.food_options: Simple snacks and occasional food trucks
bars.local_tips: Popular summer spot where you can play pétanque while enjoying a pastis like a true local

bars.name: Le Bistrot d'Alco
bars.atmosphere: Authentic neighborhood bar with no pretensions
bars.local_tips: Experience everyday local life with regulars who have been coming for years, unfussy and authentic

bars.name: Papa Doble
bars.local_tips: Named after Hemingway's favorite daiquiri, offers the best rum selection in Montpellier

highlights: Les Halles Castellane market exploration
Regional cheese and wine tastings
Local olive oil and honey sampling
food_tours.booking_tips: Morning tours recommended to experience the market at its best

Gourmet picnic lunch with vineyard views

Historic cafés and food shops
Sweet specialties of Languedoc

Oyster farm tour with tasting
Seafood lunch in Sète or Bouzigues

cooking_classes.name: Atelier Gourmet
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Classes for all levels, focuses on seasonal Mediterranean cooking

cooking_classes.name: Les Ateliers de la Maison Méditerranéenne
cooking_classes.booking_tips: More advanced techniques, some cooking experience helpful but not required

cooking_classes.name: Cook'n with Class Montpellier
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Small-group experience with market tour included, begins in the morning

markets.name: Les Halles Castellane

Fresh seafood, produce, and prepared foods
Oyster bars and wine counters where you can eat on-site

Local farmers and producers
Regional specialties and street food

markets.name: Marché du Lez
highlights: Contemporary food hall with various vendors
Craft food producers
Regular farmers markets and special events
markets.local_tips: Modern market complex with a selection of trendy food vendors, regular special events and farmers markets on weekends

highlights: North African and Mediterranean specialties
Spices and international ingredients
Affordable produce
